meanings.definition: Gradually reduce or write off the cost or value of an asset over a period of time.
meanings.sent1: The company amortised the cost of the new machinery over five years.
meanings.sent2: She amortised the loan by making monthly payments.
meanings.sent3: The accountant joked that they could amortise the office snacks over a year.
meanings.sent4: The memories of childhood were amortised by the passing of time.
meanings.sent5: The colors of the sunset were slowly amortised into darkness.

meanings.definition: Pay off a debt with regular payments.
meanings.sent1: He amortised his credit card debt by paying a fixed amount each month.
meanings.sent2: They decided to amortise the mortgage to avoid high interest.
meanings.sent3: The student playfully suggested amortising the homework by doing a little each day.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness towards others was a way to amortise the debts of gratitude.
meanings.sent5: The laughter of friends helped amortise the stress of the workweek.
